ygData.subject: Re: Selos and trains underground
ygData.msgSnippet: I was in CT today, and heard Train coming, move it or lose it . my group was just organizing at the tree in the CY, so i popped on Invis, and we watched. The
ygData.messageBody:
I was in CT today, and heard "Train coming, move it or lose it". my
group was just organizing at the tree in the CY, so i popped on Invis,
and we watched. The warrior who shouted train came the door and had AT
LEAST 8 lizzies. So it does seem that more will chase you than 4.

BTW, my group got a big kick out of me saying "Hail a silvered lizard"
and Hail to every other type walking by. that is how we know there were
at leat 8, they all walked in a nice parade by us. :)

Uldar Ulfangson
33rd Bard, Rodcet Nife

> Message: 25
> Date: Thu, 2 Dec 1999 16:21:38 -0500 (EST)
> From: <kim@...>
> Subject: RE: Selos and trains underground
>
> On Tue, 30 Nov 1999, JasonF wrote:
> >
> > Well I must admit that my speed did indeed cause what several people told me
> > was 'the biggest train in Cazic-Thule that I've ever seen'. A few levels
> > [...]
> > maybe 15-20 lizards behind me. Then I hit the maze. The maze is just that,
> > and I got lost. While frantically searching for the way out, I'm getting
> > hit by lizards that I blaze past and picking them up in turn. Well by the
>
> I'm not really sure this is possible if you're alone. If you
> wade into a 5+ mob camp with your AOE songs going, you'll
> notice only 4 of them will attack you at a time. The rest
> will stay where they are and ignore you until one of the mobs
> attacking you dies.
>
> I suppose it could be that if they're all chasing you, then
> none of them are attacking you, so all of them can chase
> you. I'll have to try that.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
